alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 04 at 10:51PM CDT until August 05 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of west central Illinois and northeast Missouri, including the following counties, in west central Illinois, Hancock and McDonough. In northeast Missouri, Clark and Scotland. * WHEN...Until 10 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms with heavy rain will move across the area into early Saturday morning. There`s the potential for 2 to 4 inches of rain, with locally higher amounts possible where storms move over the same areas repeatedly. Southern portions of the watch area appear most favored for the heavier rain amounts.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
